Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Laila T
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and helpful , checked me in at 10 am away before the check in time which should be at 3 pm. The room is amazing it is very clean, wide and comfortable. It has a kitchenette and they offer free coffee packs. Moreover , the 101 cafe is amazing, it offers wide variety of tasty food and refreshments. Finally , it's a 10 minutes walk to Hollywood Blvd and you can reach almost all attraction in 10-15 mintues if you have a car. WIFI is very good and free.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Clairebeah
Reviews.Content: If you want a great location within easy walk to everything then this is your spot. The area was very safe to walk in at night which we had to do a few times. It's a very close walk to the Metro and Hollywood Blvd. We chose the Hotel as it had an onsite Cafe which had great and very affordable food and also the self service laundry facilities which were needed due to the length of our holiday. The hotel is two buildings, the first being roadside and the second overlooking the pool. We had an executive king room in the roadside building. Traffic noise was never a problem and the room was HUGE. Although our room had a mini kitchen including microwave and fridge, there was absolutley no plates and cutlery avaliable which was odd. Cleaning staff did a fantastic job each day and were very friendly as was front dest. Free WIFI was great and fast. My only gripe with the Hotel is the rooms were old and in need of a spruce up. All the rooms in the roadside building appeared to be dated including old furniture and carpets. All in all we were happy with our choice and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, great location”
Reviews.Author: joanne t
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 6 nights - very impressed - room was great, loved the photos hanging throughout the hotel; bathroom impressive and with a view to Hollywood sign - front desk staff always friendly and helpful - computer in hotel lobby to check e-mails - free - location was brilliant - we walked down to Hollywood Boulevard every day - safe neighbourhood - Metro buses and trains 5 minute walk (much cheaper than taxis $5 all day pass) just need lots of time when using public transport - diner on site - open till 3am - Joe's mart just next door for bottles of water - cheap

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: nuttynel
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to LA and stayed here 4 nights we chose this hotel to good reviews and was not disappointed. Easy check in, great friendly staff and loved the decor. Room was perfect for us a family of 5. Opened curtains to see Hollywood sign. Well impressed with the bathroom. Big tv,clean carpets and very comfortable beds(although they were high our toddler struggled to get off /on bed)Paid for roll away bed didn't use as beds were big enough. Rooms cleaned daily. Didn't try pool, tried cafe 101 very tasty food shame they dont do kids portions, (not part of hotel). Location was a 10 min walk to walk of fame, and felt quite safe walking there in evening. A garage nearby we got snacks/drinks from and a fabulous bakery next door we got our breakfasts from. We had to pay for valet of car even though we didn't use car at all because the public transport is very good and very cheap and the traffic is manic so was easier to walk/ public transport everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here”
Reviews.Author: ek80
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I'd been to LA so it was a bit daunting trying to pick a hotel. This came highly recommended and so with that we decided to stay. We arrived late and the staff were still wide awake and helpful and attentive. Our room was immaculate and very comfortable and easily fit 3 adults to share. The staff were really helpful fetching extra hangers when needed. The pool looked lovely and clean though we didn't get a chance to try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Susie S
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Best Western for 4 night for a family vacation. In a nutshell... location is good, neighborhood is safe, rooms are decent and customer service is great! The cons.... They do not give you an option to valet your car or not and they automatically charge you $15 a night to do so. This is the second highest valet amount I paid the whole trip. Also, maid service could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and safe”
Reviews.Author: euchreman
Reviews.Content: Having reserved this hotel in advance, the check in was flawless and the two reception fellows very helpful and friendly. The room was not overly large, but quite big enough for a stay in a city. The location was well withion walking distance of the major attractions of Hollywood Boulevard, and we found it quite safe to wander around. The hotel itself is located in a pleasant residential neighbourhood. I'm not too sure what the previous reviewer was trying to say, but actually it is Hollywood Boulevard itself that is a bit seedy, although there is a lot of activity there. Although we had our attractions already booked the hotel staff are readily available to assist their guests in this. Nothing was too much trouble. The restaurant attached to the hotel is great - although for fine dining a trip outside is necessary . It is a very good coffee shop with quite a varied menu, especially for breakfast. All in all we had a wonderful time and give this hotel full marks. Thank you Best Western Hollywood Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Liberty817
Reviews.Content: We were planning thow to see the Cirque show so we decided to stay in Hollywood. We are from San Diego so we know Hollywood is a little rough but we wanted to walk to the Kodak Theatres and see the sites on the way. So we read TA reviews and booked this hotel. I don't think the parking is free anymore but we found a parking spot right next to the hotel. We were planning to pay for parking but this spot was literally next door. So I think we saved 12.00. The lobby has many pictures hanging of famous actors and was going for the old Hollywood Vibe. The hotel is in rectangle shape with the pool in the middle. Our room was on the bottom floor and when we entered the room we were surprised with all of the art they had up. It was similiar to the lobby but they had even cooler pictures, some were even new like Harry Potter and old like the Beatles. We were able to walk all the way to the Kodak Theatres from our hotel and see everything on the way and get some good food. Maybe a mile or two. It was a little seedy until we actually got to Hollywood Boulevard, which is funny to say because the Boulevard is a litte seedy. What I really mean is unlike the Boulevard where there is traffic and stores, where we walked, it did not have alot of pedestrians walking around. If my husband was not there, I probably wouldn't have walked by myself (even though I know I would have because I would convince myself not be a wimp). I didn't get to eat at the restaurant because we were going to try out this awesome breakfast place down the road. If you want to cheap hotel close to Hollywood Boulevard this is it. I am more of a people watcher person so I would probably stay more on the boulevard if I had too this again but that would also cost about about $100 more.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kafkirk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in Feb 2012. We found the staff very helpful and polite. The rooms were clean. The location is terrific. The price is unbeatable. The 101 restaurant is a funky little diner. Can't say enough about this place. It's a great buy.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic & welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Zymotic
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in Jan 12 - family of 4 sharing one room. First room allocated in 'Motel' section was clean & spacious enough but right by air-conditioning unit, so too noisy for us. No problem in moving to 'Hotel' section,which was much better. Location good - easy 10 minute walk onto Hollywood Boulevard. Hotel arranged 'Stars Homes Tour' for us with hotel pick-up - Buddy Fun Bus - very good. Diner onsite was the only decent restaurant we found in the area - good value evening meal & convenient for breakfast. Friendly & efficient valet parking. Very helpful Reception desk - nothing too much trouble. Great 'Hollywood' movies theme throughout hotel. All in all this hotel provides good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Tricky Traffic Spot but handy!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryScot
Reviews.Content: When arriving by car it is a bit of a zoo getting into the car park - not a big fan of the valet system either. Prefer to park my own car! It is close to the main Hollywood attractions but you do have to walk sown the dodgy end to reach Kodak Theater and the hub - however, it is a decent hotel with nice clean room and all amenities you need! Just be prepared for the traffic. There is a nice little market if you walk east on Franklin where you can get a nice coffee and pastry if you want alternative to the hotel's 101 cafe which is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Honey4u2dip
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Jan 28 - 31, 2012. It was my first time staying here so I did not know what to expect. The hotel does a wonderful job keeping everything clean, from the lobby to the bedrooms. I stayed in room 124, which is on the first floor across from the pool. The room was spacious, clean, and very modern looking. The bathroom was big too. The room had a coffee maker, refrigerator and microwave. I was able to get the room for $108 a night. I believe if you have AAA it may be cheaper. The air conditioner worked well. The only problem I had, was that you could hear everything. My sleep was interrupted many times because I could hear the people who were hanging out by the pool area. I could also hear the TV in the room next to me. Room 124 is right by the ice machine. A plus and negative at the same time. Unfortunately, I could hear when people were getting ice. Which kind of stinks when it is 3AM and your trying to sleep. I believe it took us about 15-20min to walk to the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Do yourself a favor, and walk over to the W hotel which is about four blocks away from the Best Western Hollywood Hills, and go to the Metro station and buy a $5.00 subway pass. You can use this all day. Take the subway to Hollywood and Wine where all the action is, and it will drop you off right by the Kodak theatre within a matter of minutes. There is also a outdoor mall. This was very handy when I did not want to deal with the many people laying on the street asking for money. Attached to this hotel is a GREAT place to eat. I highly recommend ordering the chocolate brownie waffle, which comes with two scoops of vanilla ice cream and chocolate syrup drizzled on top. A wonderful dessert, enough for two people to share. The batter is nice and light. :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, sassy, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Mark_in_Portland
Reviews.Content: We found our room to be very clean, all the modern conveniences, etc - just what we needed for our stay in the Hollywood area. The hotel is 'sassy' in that they have made successful efforts to style the hotel in the hey days of Hollywood- photos of the stars, 1950's colors and fixtures throughout the hotel. Staff have been entirely welcoming; note that Valet Parking is a necessary feature at at extra charge. Hotel is VERY close to the freeway, so both freeway noise but great freeway access are part of the deal.

Reviews.Title: “Really a Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: JTorres80
Reviews.Content: Really a nice and clean hotel for the price. Very contemporary, large TV, comfy beds, clean with all the necessities. Good location, near the freeway and walking distance to Hollywood Blvd. and everything going on there. Great diner (101 diner) attached to the hotel with good food, service and atmosphere..and it opens early and stays open until 3 am!! Some of the downfalls may be big for some people but for the price, not so bad. The air conditioner/heater is loud, if you get a room on the street side, it's loud (they should invest in dual paned windows) and.....that's really it! Bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Tine M
Reviews.Content: When you are visiting LA and are interested in hollywood the location of this hotel is fabulous. It is on walking distance to the walk of fame and the kodak theatre. The staff is friendly and helpfull. The rooms are centered around the outside pool. The room is comfortable, clean, and spacious. The photo's on the wall remind you that you're in hollywood. The only downside for us was the noise of the airconditioningsystem that is outside next to the pool area, but definitly disturbing if you're room is close to it. We visited this hotel twice and would definitly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Nice Hotel but noisy room heater”
Reviews.Author: singharay
Reviews.Content: The Location is close to Hollywood Bld but not very close. You need to walk few blocks.The reception of the hotel is very nicely decorated. Rooms are also spacious but room heater of my room was very noisy. The property is on the main road hence it can be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Kofbrisvegas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and maintained to a good standard. The location however seems a bit misleading... it is a 20min walk through a worrying area to get to the "hollywood sites" The coffee shop attached is quite nice for an easy meal, wait staff are ok. Don't bother asking the front desk staff for anything as they seem to be lacking energy and local knowledge. the rate we got was good but I would pay more for a closer hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, good location& good value make up for the noisy environment”
Reviews.Author: AquaNut
Reviews.Content: We spent Thansgiving weekend at this hotel and were generally pleased. The room was Huge and nicely appointed dual sinks, marble bath, big flat screen and fun memorabilia. All at a great price. I'd rate it a five but we were on the Franklin ave side and there's a lot of street noise. Nothing the room a/c doesnt sort of drown out, but you definately dont want your windows open Try to get a room on the opposite side away from the street. Finally- not much to recommend the downstairs coffee shop. Walk east a few blocks to The Oaks on Bronson fo awesome coffee and gourmet food.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money. Good location. Quirky. Fun.”
Reviews.Author: bgsu3
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is a great hotel. I stayed here in 2006, and they have definitely upgraded since then. (I learned after the fact that the nice men I joked around with in the lobby were actually the owners. Very likeable gentlemen.) This hotel is of a "vintage" style that you won't find in a new hotel. the design is quirky, and we found it to be charming - a nice glimpse into yesteryear. Because of that, though, the bathroom was a little cramped, but it was still nice, well-appointed, and clean. If you like places with character, you'll like this Best Western. Oh - and the restaurant downstairs (The 101 Coffee Shop) is terrific. We ate there three times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daz793
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a few streets away from Hollywood Blvd and easy walking distance, but we felt unsafe walking home due to the beggers around the Blvd in the evening. The hotel was easy to find just off the 101. The rooms were very clean, LCD TV and coffee making facility's in the room. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms very nice with double walk in shower. Nice coffee shop attached to the hotel. We were charged 15$ for over night parking.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK but deterioring environment”
Reviews.Author: JC_and_JS
Reviews.Content: This hotel, in the middle of Hollywood, suffers the most from the deterioring environment that Hollywood has become. This part of the city has had its best time long ago and is going downwards. Even if the hotel is close to the walk of fame, you will see that a lot of shops have been closed already years ago, and the shops that are left are “cheap”. You will not find any restaurant in the close neighborhood of the hotel. Above that, the restaurant of the hotel itself is noisy and cold, and not a good alternative either. The room we received however was OK. It was big and clean, and had a small kitchenette with microwave. Hotel staff was helpfull and friendly. In general it is like another traveler mentioned already before: not the hotel loses the stars, it's the location. Because of the environment, we would however not recommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spainhols
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four staying in one room. The room was quite a good size and very comfortable. Swimming pool right outside. There is the 101 Coffee Shop next to reception which serves good food all day and appears popular with local people. It is a bit of a walk to the Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theatre etc. Friendly and helpful staff especially the valet parking. Easy driving distance to Disneyland and Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of extra fees/conflicting rates!”
Reviews.Author: Parker D
Reviews.Content: This hotel's daily rates really vary depending on the rate you get quoted when calling the hotel & what you can find on line - so definitely do some investigation work/inquiries before you book... I needed a room last minute on a Friday evening (around 6pm), so I called the hotel personally, and was quoted a rate of $250. I decided to give it another chance & later looked/booked on line for $179 & when I checked in (around 7:30pm), was told I got the very last room they had. Seems better business sense to just book the last room for something, rather then risk losing a sale… But I guess someone else would have came along & paid the $250 around 8pm!. Also just FYI - the taxes are average $25 per night, they also charge you tourism tax (what ever that is) per day which also varies in price daily (around $2.75), an energy fee per night of $5.00, and parking which is $15 per day. And the final disclosure - they charge $75 per day for pets. So just so you know/factor in the added expenses, when staying at this particular Best Western (privately owned with 86 rooms), that along with the sliding differential daily room rate, expect to pay the extras listed above (average $48 per day) & ($123 with a pet per day). So in my opinion/in the end, you can probably stay somewhere more conducive and personable for the added multifarious fees.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect but the location”
Reviews.Author: karsiyakali_eatl
Reviews.Content: We planes to spent 4 days in LA as part of our US trip. We were planning to find a hotel around Santa Monica but due to budgetary purposes we switched this hotel. They don't offer breakfast at the hotel but there is this diner called 101 Coffee, and it has an enterance from the hotel. They have wide range of offer. The staff was friendly and they helped us to book for a bus tour. Hence we wanted a 2 hour bus tour, when we arrived to the ticket station we learnt it is an open bus. And even the driver of the tour wasn't sure about this. The bus was old and we had an accident as well. You might want to check other options in front of Kodak Theather. By the way, the tour was for Hollywood Sign and famous people's houses. Beside this, we were really happy with our choice. Our room was big and it was really cool with Al Pacino's pictures on the walls. We also had view of Hollywood sign :)

Reviews.Title: “Sweet little place”
Reviews.Author: klahaye
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Walk in minutes to mass transit, Hollywood and Vine, shopping and lots of restaurants. The rooms have some decent views, nothing special, but are clean and quiet for Hollywood! The best thing about the hotel, for us, was where it is. You can be on the freeway in minutes, or in the midst of it all on foot, and mass transit is also very close. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel! Second time we have stayed there!”
Reviews.Author: trishtraffic
Reviews.Content: Great value and location in Hollywood. Very close to Hollywood/Vine and Hollywood/Highland. You can walk to many tourist attractions. Very clean, updated rooms, friendly staff, great little pool, and wonderful coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not quality sleep”
Reviews.Author: StefRich
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights here after travelling around the West Coast for two weeks. The location is very good, really handy to wander around - something not many people do in LA! Having read previous reviews we did request a room at the back near the pool but received one right at the front. The room was very big, lovely and clean and fresh but unfortunately the windows couldn't cut out all of the noise so sleep wasn't great. I would still recommend though for the price and location, you can catch up on sleep when you're at home!

Reviews.Title: “a good choice close to hollywood and universal studios”
Reviews.Author: lesver28
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel close to Hollywood boulevard (10 mn walking) and universal studios (15 mn driving). There is a parking with a valet service but it is quite expensive (15$ per night). There is a swimming-pool as well. The room is large and the bathroom as well. There is a small kitchen with a fridge and a microwave (useful). Decorated with a lot of pictures from stars and movies. The air conditioning was a little bit noisy. There is a supermarket with all you can need a few minutes ahead on franklin avenue. The area is safe for walking. A restaurant is located just near the hotel but it is not very good, noisy, with waiters always in a hurry. Available for breakfast early in the morning then crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great and interesting place.”
Reviews.Author: Sampson310
Reviews.Content: The room is good sized, the bathroom is large and the diner served the best ever kale salad but had lots of good typical diner food too. The only elevator is small but I am sure that couldn't be changed.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveller_m8
Reviews.Content: Great little fine. Best value for money. Great location, excellent service, stayed here for 4 nights and had no issues at all

Reviews.Title: “One of the best kept secrets in Hollywood area”
Reviews.Author: ASchaidler
Reviews.Content: remodeled with all new furnishings, marble spa shower and bathroom, marble kitchenette wet bar, great mattress for sleeping, collectible quality autographed artwork on the walls, spotlessly clean guestrooms, cute pool in the courtyard, and an amazing top notch diner restaurant off the lobby (the food is really THAT good, service fast and friendly). Walking distance to the Hollywood & Vine Metro subway stop, and just 2 blocks off the #101 Freeway, secure parking is worth the valet fee. It's maybe 1 mile east of the 'heart' of Hollywood, but certainly close to everything and a bargain for it's location and upgraded condition. Look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hollywood location”
Reviews.Author: Swede75_london
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Room sizes is very generous and clean. Good budget hotel, but with a $5 energy tax and $15 for the hotel parking it adds up... Nothing special. I do recommende cafe 101 at the ground floor for breakfast etc. I think it is different ownership from best western. Security is average on the wing above the parking garage... visitors can bypass the reception. Felt reasonably safe anyway. Very close to the hollywood blvd with allthe stars (about 2 blocks). Wifi free withgood coverage...but very patchy speeds (unuseable) a lot of the time. Too many users orsomething else???

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: Shankpony
Reviews.Content: My Brother and I stayed here recently and we were very impressed. Recent renovations we heard had mostly been completed and the rooms were very nice and comfortable beds. We had a fridge and microwave (tucked away int he closet) and the shower and bathroom was clean and big. It's close enough to Hollywood BLVD and everything is within walking distance ora short cab. And it's enough off the strip to make it cozy. I'd stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “An apotheosis of cool.”
Reviews.Author: woodyaps
Reviews.Content: Came out to Hollywood to see God of Caranage at The Ahmanson Theatre. First off: the location of this hotel is perfect! Near cool food places--and the Arclight Theatre. Secondly, and most importantly, the rooms are great--and with cool movie posters. And...check out the bathrooms. Huge. My wife died and went to heaven. Next time in Hollywood...this is my spot!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMSBir
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for couple of nights at end of trip around LA. Hotel was easy to find located just off freeway. Hotel was undergoing renovation whilst we stayed however this didnt have a big impact on our stay. Staff on reception were very helpful and informative and arranged a tour for us. Our room was ready early and they also arranged a late check out for us. Hotel itself is small but adequate for our needs. Pool again small, only room for 19 people, but wasnt an issue for us as hotel was quiet. Restaurant/ cafe situated in hotel gets very busy and breakfast was ok, quite a bit of choice. We ate at a nice italian around 3 blocks away, busy but good food and customer service. We went shopping at a mall that the reception recommended, around a 15 min drive, but very pleasant mall with nice outdoor area. In terms of location, probably around 15 min walk to centre of hollywood. Located around 25 mins drive to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE IN HOLLYWOOD”
Reviews.Author: AHardDaysNight
Reviews.Content: I am not a big fan of Best Western because they are usualy old/run down. This place was great! Inexpensive. Huge remodeled room/bathroom/kithcen area. Clean! Neighborhood is safe with beautiful properties across the street. Parking attendant helped us find a place to park our car late at night. Located super close to the Hollywood strip but up the hill in the residential section.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for nice room close to Hollywood attractions”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler012
Reviews.Content: The rooms were splendid inside, recently renovated, roomy with large bathrooms. This hotel is well-located on Franklin Street in Hollywood, just two blocks north of Hollywood Boulevard. It's within walking distance (though a long walk) of the core Hollywood sites at Hollywood and Highland. The parking is all valet parking and costs $15 a night extra at the hotel. There is a nice grocery and some quiet restaurants about 3 blocks east on Franklin, and since the hotel room had a fridge and microwave we bought bagels and croissants there and were able to save on breakfasts. Franklin Street is fairly quiet, but there was lots of noise from the freeway if you opened your windows (not bad otherwise). The shower was quirky, but otherwise no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “always good”
Reviews.Author: milou9
Reviews.Content: Although they are renovating the hotel, our stay was peaceful and quiet. The rooms are clean and spacious, location is perfect, the coffe shop downstairs a delight. We always stay there, we will always stay there. The renovations are excellent and the look will be great. The staff is very nice and comfy, family like. The price perfect. I highly recommend it and I have stayed everywhere in LA. From the chicest hotels to Hip hotels, this one is the best for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: socarras4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. They are going through renovations, but it was very quiet. We chose the back building, that is where the pool was too. The rooms are clean, the staff is great and the location was walking distance to hollywood blvd. They have great restaurants 2 blocks away and it is very safe. We would definitely stay there again. They charge you a $15 parking fee, but most hotels in Hollywood do the same. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, but .....”
Reviews.Author: jjtlm
Reviews.Content: Normally I would recommond this hotel to anyone. We've stayed here several times over the past 4 years and loved it. The hotel is clean, you're close to everything and the rates are reasonable if you're there off season. Unfortunately they made a few changes on our last stay. They've added a charge of $15 a night to park your car. They've also added a valet service for the attached restaurant, so the valet fills up the parking ramp with restaurant customers and there's no place for the hotel guests to park. The valet then shuttles your car to a "secure" parking area a couple blocks away, and everytime you want to go someplace you have to wait for the valet to have time to get your car and bring it back .. all for a mere $15 a night. We really liked the hotel, too bad they had to screw it up .... I think it's time to find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: kermit2831
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for location, which was perfect. The hotel does not look like much from the outside. The lobby also left much to be desired, as did the current construction. This made us a little nervous, but we were pleasantly surprised by the room . Very spacious, modernized, clean. The bathroom was modern and very clean. There is a kitchenette with a refrigerator and microwave, and a coffee maker. The parking was extra - $15.00 a day, which I thought was a bit much. We tried to find street parking, but it was impossible. The valet was extremely nice and helpful. There is a convenient coffee shop attached to the hotel. It suited us just fine, and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay”
Reviews.Author: momaveenendaal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 14 until 17 February 2011. We intended to travel further to Loreto in Mexico and had a shortbreak to visit Hollywood. It was really lovely. Allthough there were some building works we had a nice stay. We loved the personnel that was very helpful with ordering cabs and excursions. We booked this hotel via the internet according to what we read on Tripadvisor and we were pleased. For the breakfast we visited 3 times the 101 Café that was inside the hotel (not same owner though) and it was the best place for your breakfast around. For our evening dinner there were enough restaurants in the neighbourhood to choose from. In one word GREAT place to stay for our shortbreak.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SHORT TRIP PLACE”
Reviews.Author: 54Penny
Reviews.Content: I was a little worry about the construction (hotel getting a face lift) but they didn't start till after 9am. The staff was great and helpful when it came to tips on what to do and how to save money doing it. At first we were given a room with double beds when I told them I requested a king they corrected it right away the bathroom had double sinks and showers with great water pressure. We had a refrigerator, microwave, etc. and free wifi. One of the things I like was the staff give us a number to a store that delivered anything you may need. The cafe101 connected to hotel had the best breakfast ever. Everything was easy to get to trains and buses within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: hawk_wanderer
Reviews.Content: nice place to stay. within walking distance from the famous kodak theatre (oscars)... walk of fame, chinese theatre, madam tussad, etc. clean rooms, above average service. yes and they provide free internet facility :)

Reviews.Title: “Great but got some attitude from valet”
Reviews.Author: kpim
Reviews.Content: Don't judge the hotel by the outside. We drove up to find the valet just sitting out on the road and basically told us we can park our own car. Based on the outside and the valet, we weren't expecting much. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked in and found that the hotel is pretty nice inside and our room was very spacious. It's walking distance to hollywood blvd and about a mile to the Chinese Theatre. Then we left to have dinner and came back around 1130. Based on our previous experience with Valet, we tried to park our own car. The new valet person pretty much yelled at us, asked if we were staying at the hotel, then demanded proof that we were staying at the hotel. After showing him our hotel key, he condescendingly asked us if we were staying here or if our friends are staying here and we're just using their key, he asked 20 questions about when we checked in, what room number we were in, and if the hotel knows we're parking a vehicle. I guess because we're in our mid 20s we don't look like we can afford the best western?? He was such a jerk and ruined our stay. Luckily the staff in the hotel was very nice and kinda made up for it. I would probably stay again but park on the street just to avoid dealing with the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Universal and Walk of fame”
Reviews.Author: relaxingtime7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, we arrived early and our room was ready.We were overlooking the hollywood sign and the freeway,thought the freeway was going to keep us awake but it didn't. The staff were great,the rooms were large and the food at 101 cafe is excellant.Grab the subway to universal or walk down to the Walk of Fame its not far to either,very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “WISH I COULD RECOMMEND BUT...”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: The Best Western has lot going for it: it's low-key, a 10 min walk to Hollywood and Vine, nicely remodeled rooms at a great price and a polite staff. A solid three star property with a microwave and fridge but no in-room safe (which I strongly prefer). The only downside for me was the noxious orange-scented cleaner stench that permeated the room and gave me a headache. I'm surprised no one else has mentioned this. It's truly over-powering and unpleasant, something dive motels use to cover up an even worse smell! If you have a low tolerance for fragrances like I do, do not stay here. I looked at other rooms since I wanted out of my room, but they all had the same strong orange disinfectant smell, which prohibits me from staying here again. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel close to the Walk of fame on Hollywood blvd”
Reviews.Author: aikman04
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel. The rooms were quite big and included a small kitchen. There is one open air pool in the center of the hotel. The pool was clean but a bit cold (no heating). Friendly staff at the desk. I can recommend the breakfast in the diner which is part of the hotel, the diner is called "101".

Reviews.Title: “better vale somewhere esle”
Reviews.Author: none60750
Reviews.Content: the hotel played tape music untill 9pm. room was somewhat small. there was a tripadvisor comment that room was huge. our room was small. granted the hotel was/is remodeling the outside. the personnel were heelpful but there still better value somewhere esle

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Fairywren8
Reviews.Content: On vacation from Australia and stayed for at the Best Western Hollywood Hills for a couple of days while we went to Universal Studios, Hollywood etc. My children are 2, 9, and 13. Even though renovations were going on, it was still fine. Staff very helpful, rooms clean and very close to Hollywood Walk of Fame (about 5-10mns walk). Would recommend to friends and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was wonderful..great location!”
Reviews.Author: julesinpa33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you want to be close to the action in Hollywood. Many things are in walking distance. If you are going soon, just to warn you, there is construction going on there to the building. The coffee shop attached is the 101 Coffee Shop and there are always famous people in there:) We just saw Megan Fox and Brian Austin Greene there yesterday. Rooms are not fancy but do the job. Just make sure you search rates online via Expedia, Orbitz..etc. If you cal the hotel directly to book, you will pay alot more:(

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Charliegirl211
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and the bedroom and bathroom were enormous. The valet parking was great and made it easy for our stay. The food at cafe 101 was great too. The location was handy for hollywood boulevard. However the guy on the desk was not the best informed he appeared to know only about the tour companies they had links with, we were trying to find out if there was a "hop on hop off Bus" and we were informed that LA didn't have one of those, however when we walked along the boulevard we found that at least one company ran one!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lots of character!”
Reviews.Author: karogies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and comfortable with an enormous bathroom. We also had a small kitchen with a sink, fridge and microwave. I'm not sure if that is standard. The walls throughout the hotel and in your room are covered with movie memorabilia which is really fun. They are renovating the outside of the hotel so it doesn't look like much from outside, but inside is great. The 101 Coffeshop attached is AWESOME! It has everything from breakfast to vegan food to pastrami, ice cream, all types of alcohol. Its got a great vibe, too. The only criticism is that it is too good and probably kept us from trying other places as it was so convenient and delicious. It's just a few blocks from the famous Hollywood and Vine. This hotel is a great place in a great location for a great price. Its comfortable with lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “At last some sanity.”
Reviews.Author: milou9
Reviews.Content: After a disastrous stay at the W Hollywood, this time we took a chance with the Best Western on Franklin Avenue. It is simple and great, and quiet, even though the hotel is being renovated, it was still a pleasant stay. The rooms are clean, bathroom very large, a very cute pool, and above all : QUIET. The coffee shop downstairs is wonderful, full of interesting youngsters, the food is very good, the music very Hip. I felt as we had a trip back in time to the 60' in LA. The architecture, the staff, very knowledgeable, the breakfast, it felt so relaxing. I will go back of course, as it will become my number one choice for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay- great location ( what you should know about breakfast)”
Reviews.Author: kirbyglad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing external renovation, but don't let that keep you away. The rooms are clean, modern, and comfy. There is a 2 person shower instead of a bathtub (if that makes a difference to you). We really enjoyed our stay. The film memorobelia is great. The Hollywood Walk of Fame ( with the Kodak and Grauman's Chinese theaters) is a 10 minute walk, and Universal Studios is a 10 minute drive - you can't beat the location. The breakfas at the cafe t is awesome - get the rush hour special for $6. It's great. One thing you need to know however: the Orange Juice is abolutely delicious and $5 per glass! I took my family of 6 for what I was thinking would be a $40 breakfast, but with orange juice and a 18% service charge they added to my bill, it was over $90. Yummy, just unexpected. I would stay ere again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The first stop on our tour of California...”
Reviews.Author: Rakeshtak
Reviews.Content: The first stop on our tour of California travelling from UK. A nice quirky place situated close to Hollywood Boulevard and Sunset Blvd. Our queen room was well equipped with coffee maker, fridge, free wifi and iPod music system which was great to charge the iPhone. There is currently some construction work being carried out (oct 10) so it can be noisy, our room window was facing a brick wall with scaffolding, but preferred this to facing the noisy freeway. The bathroom was large and with all toiletries and the wardrobe being here too. There was an iron and ironing board which we didn't use. With the scaffolding, this means there is mandatory chargeable valet parking (around $5 per night) plus tourist tax of $6 per night. Also factor in a customary valet tip upon collection of your vehicle. There is a cafe as part of the hotel, their rush hour breakfast left me with a sensitive stomach. The lobby staff were friendly and helpful, but the maid service were conservative with milk and sugar. Overall I recommend this place but would not pay full price and advise to go through a broker such as Expedia for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: MusicIsLife702
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 1 night stay at the BWHH. The front desk staff are very friendly & helpful. This hotel is located near everything you could ever want to see in Hollywood. We would definitely recommend this place to anyone interested in visiting this area. Don't forget to try the Brownie Waffle in their downstairs diner - so good!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the West - value, function and form!”
Reviews.Author: AvilaWineFamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous!! Hollywood is really tricky - even for some someone who lived there for many years. We were so thrilled to find a place that offered a clean, safe environment that is ultra cool and right next to all the things we needed to access. We will be back in two weeks and already booked our reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quirky and well situated. Great place to stay. Thanks Max!!”
Reviews.Author: BennyDoran
Reviews.Content: Found this place by chance, as we weren't booked in. Stayed 6 nights in the building that faces out on Franklin Avenue and was instantly taken with the place. Rooms were large and spacious, well aired and very tidy indeed, with quality consumables in the bathroom. The hotel is in easy walking distance to Hollywood Blvd. Chinese Theatre etc, and a short drive to the Hollywood sign. Loads of restaurants within a short distance also. We were made to feel at home by Max at reception, and he was very knowledgeable about things to do locally, which was a big help. He is also a very fun guy and worth getting to know. The 101 Cafe is on-site, and apparently has been used in TV shows like Gilmore Girls and others and is apparently a favourite hang-out of Eva Longoria's, although I didn't think it was anything particularly special. Proximity to Highway 101 makes it very easy to access. Free parking and internet were a huge bonus as parking around here can be expensive. Will definitely be back here!!

Reviews.Title: “Really good value for your money with an amazing cafe with it!”
Reviews.Author: matt303939
Reviews.Content: Loved it here, the staff were really helpful and in a great location, just 5 mins walk to the start of the walk of fame. There is free parking which is difficult to find in LA. The pool is small but nice to chill around, the rooms are spacious with big bathooms and a hollywood theme. The best thing about the hotel is Cafe 101, they do the best breakfasts, or after a night out, the best nightcaps! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, brilliant value and fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: jonathan030
Reviews.Content: Normally I wouldn't review a hotel online, but after having a brilliant stay at the Best Western Hollywood Hills I decided that I would have make an exception. When arriving at the hotel It was clear to myself and my friend that we certainly weren't staying in six star luxury, the outside of the building looked a tad weathered to say the least. However once inside the Hotel we were very impressed. The Hotel staff were welcoming and were very helpful with excellent knowledge of LA and its attractions. Our twin double bedded room was clean, comfortable and very roomy, we were particularly impressed with the large television and the spacious en-suite bathroom. Initially we were concerned with the road which our room overlooked but found that the little noise pollution wasn't a issue at all especially during the night. Quite possibly the best thing about the hotel was the amazing '101 cafe'. The cafe was reasonably priced- especially for the enormous portions of food and is open pretty much 24-7, it always had a relaxed atmosphere and a cool retro interior. The hotel is situated about a ten minute walk from Sunset Blvd and a twenty minute walk up the hill to the Hollywood sign, we both found the hotel excellent value for money and would certainly stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: nocturnalgirl72
Reviews.Content: Lobby was very small and non exciting but check in was fast. Roomn had to double beds and plenty of amenities, plasma screen TV with cable and movie channels, fridge, clock radio with an I-pod dock. Good size bathroom with dual vanity. Big shower. Room was very clean. As previously mentioned hotel full of Hollywood movie memorabilia. Location is great you are only about 20-30 minutes away from any city close to LA. 5 minutes from Hollywood and Highland. Walls seems a bit thin as I heard alot of noise outside and thought the windows were open but they werent't. Noise didn't last long. Famous cafe in hotel Cafe 101. Prices not bad but food great. Wireless internet in room worked great and was easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Innocent_Abroad
Reviews.Content: Convenient, basic motel. Reminiscent of smaller European hotels. No particular issues. Has enclosed, off-street parking at no extra cost. Has pool but it is small. Has older section where we stayed. Newer section may be more desirable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to Hollywood attractions”
Reviews.Author: scubabug
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to Hollywood walk of fame. Friendly and helpful hotel staff. Clean room but carpet is stained. Additional LA energy tax added to room - was not aware of this additional charge until check out.

Reviews.Title: “Good, peaceful base with great location for a Hollywood tourist visit.”
Reviews.Author: bargainhunterOregon
Reviews.Content: We slept well (4th floor on the back) and loved the food at the diner in the basement. Very clean and large room, Smelled and looked much better than expectations for the price, given the going rates in Hollywood. Friendly, and they let us check in early. Wifi free but slow.

Reviews.Title: “Basically a Motel, but Location saves it”
Reviews.Author: beauxl2002
Reviews.Content: Its a Best Western but is family run, and you can tell. The price was very good for Hollywood, and it certainly served its purpose. Pros - Location is excellent, 5 mins walk from Hollywood Blvd, only 2 minutes from Hwy 101, very helpful front desk, free parking in LA!, famous 101coffee shop next door. Cons - Although clean, the smell of orange air freshner was so pungent it was overpowering, tiny shady pool, car park poorly signposted (no indication it belongs to the hotel) As we were only in town one night, it was cheap and its good location, this was excellent for us. But not what you after if its a luxury gettaway to LA thats you plan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rocknrolltraveler
Reviews.Content: I travel for business constantly. I stumbled upon this hotel through Priceline and now it is my go to place when working in Hollywood. The rooms are large and clean. There is ample parking. A grocery store and a host of restaurants are just a short walk away and you a very centrally located. The internet is free as is the parking and the rates are quite good for LA. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good (room, onsite restaurant) and bad (service, noise)”
Reviews.Author: loveitoutdoors
Reviews.Content: Location is central, near the 101, you need a car, and there is not much to walk to. Our room was big, clean, and recently redone. The bathroom was over-sized and in nice new condition. The closet is in the bathroom. Internet is free, parking is free, all good in LA. The rooms on the front look out on a very busy and noisy street and the windows do not block the noise of traffic. Loud construction (backing up, beep beep beep beep beep) sounds started, early on Sat morning- they are building a new condo development. The in house restaurant had a great breakfast- it is a coffee shop that was very popular with locals. However the service was poor. I sat done and waited too long before I was asked if I wanted coffee... and then waited too long before it came. Those at the counter got faster service. Worse thing was the front desk called my room before sun up (we got to bed after 1am) to see if I had asked for a shuttle, NO! I did not! I HATE being awakened, as I do not get back to sleep easily. This mistake should have been addressed & we should have gotten an apology. We did not. (Unplug your phone!)

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood stay”
Reviews.Author: AmandaC3
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel - got two double beds as requested - good sized bathroom. A bit older with lots of memorabilia on the walls. Fairly central and reasonably priced tho - just a 5-10 min walk to Hollywood Blvd. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jackana
Reviews.Content: Great location, although it wasn't the cheapest for a Best Western, the rooms were really nice and better then you would normally get for this chain. The cafe downstairs is fantastic and great value for money...for all you sweet tooths, the BEST EVER chocolate brownie waffle with fudge sauce and ice cream!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome hotel stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: jpacella
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I travelled from the East Coast and stayed at the Best Western Hollywood Hills Hotel in Los Angeles, CA. It was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in (especially for not being a noted, high class hotel). The room was spacious with a separate, huge, double sink, tiled shower with a seat, bathroom and a separate "kitchen area". It was very impressive. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful, the hotel was very clean, and everything worked like clockwork. The free parking was a perk you don't find in LA very often. The only minor con would be the location. It was close to everything or getting to everything, but the 2 blocks in between here and there, not so nice after dark, not horrible, but not friendly. Other than that, it was a terrific pick and a great stay in Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Great coffee shop, everything else is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: StacheHunter
Reviews.Content: Twice now I've stayed at the BW Hollywood , the first time was OK and I stayed since I got a very cheap rate. Having just returned from another stay there, I can truly say "never again". BWHH has abominable parking, which you have to compete with the hipster diners at the 101 Coffee Shop for. I had to threaten the desk clerk with a phone call to the police to get a parking space I naturally expect to to receive when I pay for a room. The hipsters aren't paying to stay, just eat and hang out (the 101 is nice, but come on...paying guests come first). My room was not serviced for three days even after complaining. The maids ran the sweeper outside in the hall at 8 pm in the evening, and it was very easy to hear the iPod player in the next room. Traffic from Franklin Avenue is constant and can be very noisy late at night. Several of the poor reviews here mention bedbugs...yes, they have them now at BBHH, I discovered them the second night. While the location is great, with easy access to lots of iconic landmarks, the price you pay is for absolutely no service, surly desk clerks, and fairly loud Led Zeppelin with your eggs and toast in the morning. Best to avoid this place until they clean up their act.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: mafisc
Reviews.Content: Given that this was one of the least expensive hotels in the area, I had low expectations. I was pleasantly surprised, though. Our room had a mini-fridge, microwave, very large flat screen tv, iPod docking station, and expansive bathroom. Everything was clean and comfortable. Staff was helpful. Parking was free (although you do have to compete with patrons of the on-site restaurant for spots). There were framed autographs and photos of celebrities everywhere (including in our room). One door actually had a sign that read "Staff only or Angelina Jolie." It really made for a great Hollywood atmosphere. I have just a few negative comments. The walls are pretty thin, so we heard people coming and going late and then again beginning at 6 am. Also, the hotel entrances are locked at 11 pm. This is probably for our safety, but it was inconvenient to have to bring shopping bags and a large take-out pizza through their restaurant just to try to get back to our room. The doors had card access mechanisms which should have worked with our room keys, but they were dead-bolted instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: italyfan98
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Service was first class and the staff were very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. The location was great, minutes away from Hollywood Blvd and the many attractions there. Rooms were clean and comfortable and very roomy. The bathroom was HUGE. The price was reasonable for LA and the hotel has many day trips and activities they can arrange like tours of Hollywood. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrandiL222
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at night the area seemed shady but once we got into the room it was great. It was really clean, bathroom had granite tops, double shower. The beds were amazing, They had 2 huge pillows and the bed was so comfortable, almost better than my own. I slept great. We were able to walk about 4-6 blocks (apx) to the hollywood strip. We only planned to stay 1 night but we ended up staying 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: Pebbles23s
Reviews.Content: At first walking in, it didn't seem that nice. The lobby had a weird smell, but the room was very nice, modern and clean. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room had a nice, large flat screen TV. Excellent room for the money when compared to other hotels in the LA area

Reviews.Title: “Fine, with a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: kantoken
Reviews.Content: It's good value for the price and location if you don't need something too luxurious. The room was spacious and clean with two queen beds. Given how many of the upscale hotels charge for parking, that was a nice perk, although the slope from the upper level garage is a bit steep and we scraped the front end. The Walk of Fame is very close, although it's a bit of a hike all the way to the Chinese Theater. The biggest problem was the air conditioner--it was quite loud. Also, the bed was placed so we couldn't open the bathroom door all the way. One time the lock on the door to the room got stuck and we couldn't close it; but they sent a guy to fix it right away. Never got into the pool but it looked nice. Had a nice breakfast in the 101 Cafe. Be warned: the silver dollar pancakes are the size of a small plate!

Reviews.Title: “5 girls...walking distance to Hollywood Blvd...perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Roxy809
Reviews.Content: Thought the hotel was great....beds were SO comfortable...never slept so good until we were woken up by the noise of the construction site opposite the hotel. That was kind of annoying but unless you were planning to stay in bed all day then it doesn't really matter. and some rooms weren't as bad as others...ours was just facing the noise. Kitchen in the room was very handy and the bathrooms were great....loads of mirror space for anyone getting ready to go on a night out in Hollywood!! (Would really recommend 'Apple' night club!!! Staff at reception were so helpful and anything that we needed from tooth brushes to taxis, they sorted for us straight away. Cafe 101 was right there at the hotel and the food is great!!! If planning to walk down to Hollywood Blvd, stop off at Pinkberry on your way!!! The best frozen yogurt ever!!!!! Would def go back to the hotel on next holiday!

Reviews.Title: “car broken into-theft in parking lot”
Reviews.Author: LauraChagrin
Reviews.Content: Watch out for this place! Our car broken into & luggage stolen from the parking lot! We put my bag in the car and went back in to have breakfast at Cafe 100. When we came out to head to the airport, our car window had been broken, in broad daylight. My luggage was gone, as well as a backpack with 2 laptop computers. No one saw a thing. Management said the camera on the building that appeared to point to the parking lot was broken. I'll never leave anything in the car again at this place, nor would I stay there. It was pretty dirty. Although, I could say I was surprised I wasn't bitten by bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Average, dirty, noisy, dated, still good value for location, but must be better out there”
Reviews.Author: IceQueen1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in LA when we arrived in Hollywood hills with no plans. The service is ok, the reception alright. The rooms are a good size, but they are dated, furniture are ugly, a bit dirty, seriously noisy and the aircon sucked. But it was for one night only and it was cheap, so we sucked it up, and got on with it. It is in a good location for the walk of fame, Kodak theatre etc, which is highly overrated anyway, and also for Universal studios, so thumbs up for location. And free parking, thumbs up. This is a very average hotel that is what you expect when traveling cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in a prime location!”
Reviews.Author: steph8391
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have 3 children- 17, 13 and 10 yrs old. We chose this hoel based on price and location and were very pleasantly surprised! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to so many of the attractions, many within walkig distance. It was a very nice room, with extremely comfortable beds, the room size was nice, it had a nice kitchenette and the bathroom was very large, with a great shower. It was clean, smelled good and had nice covered parking that was free to guests. The icing on the cake was that there was a fabulous diner- 101 Cafe that is attached to the hotel and is one of the top rated diners in LA. The food is killer, with large portions and the staff are friendly, as well as efficient and on top of things. The hotel was quiet and we were so happy that we chose this hotel! I hope that this review will encourage someone to choose this hotel- it is somewhat retro and Hollywood glam- which is kind of cool too!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Los Angeles, great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Laurenantics
Reviews.Content: I was in the main part of the hotel on the 4th floor and the 3rd floor (yes, I came back!) and I love this hotel. HUGE rooms, giant bathrooms with dual sinks and awesome showers! Very comfortable beds and soft pillows. It even had a seating area with rocking chairs and a tiny kitchenette with a sink/fridge/microwave and coffee maker. The staff isn't too personable - and the property IS right on the freeway. However - the rooms and free internet and free parking totally makes up for the bad. I stayed six nights total spread over two weeks. I paid about $99-$139 per night depending on the night. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: jaefree13
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this property in as many months. Both times we were in Hollywood to see a show at the Pantages and this hotel is an easy walk to the theater and other Hollywood Blvd attractions. We found the rooms to be clean and the bathrooms were nice. There is a bit of freeway noise, but nothing the wall fan couldn't drown out. For the price, this hotel is an excellent option.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel, but terrible terrible internet connections - which is what I”
Reviews.Author: SteveCBath
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a 2 night stopover before our flight from LAX after reading some positive online comments. Pluses: We were expected - always a major plus on arrival.The rooms were fine and could actually have housed all four of us if we really needed it. The reasonable location allowed us to do the real touristy bits quite easily with a bit of walking and Reception were pretty helpful with any questions and advice. Downsides: not speaking good Spanish, I couldn't communicate easily with the cleaning team when I needed to (son got ill so we needed some things servicing but not all), and the internet connection kept dropping off randomly (this is my fifth attempt at posting this and it's taken 25 minutes and 8 reconnections so far). The only other downer was the sheer noise in the 101 diner and the poolside, with radios and music blasting out full time. Difficult to relax. Having said all of that, the only real issue was the internet connectiion, and that's only because I really needed one at the time. Usually I don't visit hotels to spend time on the internet, so this is an unusual circumstance. Annoying, but unusual. I would definitely stay here again. 2 star hotel - exactly as it says on the tin! Steve

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Surprises!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureJack
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego and wanted to go see my favorite band play at a club in the Valley. So I got a room at this hotel so I didn't have to drive home late. It was just a quick pick for some place to stay that didn't look too bad on Tripadvisor. Well....let me tell you....this place is outstanding! Clean EVERYTHING! Lobby, parking lot, rooms...all of it. I got the cheapest room with THE BEST mattress. The bathroom was out of sight wonderful. Stone counter tops and a shower you could play hand ball in. It even had a seat for the woman in your life to sit on while she shaved her legs! Seriously....the only thing missing for one of those "honey can we get away" weekends was a whirlpool tub and Al Greene music playing! But wait....there's more. I got up the next morning wanting something special for breakfast (I mean...I drove all that way so why not?). And a good non Starbucks mocha. I checked out at the front desk and heard the clinking of dishes not far from the lobby. Turns out, this"Coffee Shop" located in the same building, could totally be on Diners Drivins and Dives on the Food Channel. And....I got the best mocha as well. So good that I would go out of my way if I was anywhere close to get anther one. I met nice people at the counter while I had my great breakfast. Over all it was a wonderful surprise to stay at this hotel. You will not be disapointed unless you're one of those all you can eat for $5.99 kind who are never happy with anything in life.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Base for the L.A. Tourist!”
Reviews.Author: darylgomm
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this website about this hotel I was not expecting a great hotel. However upon arrival this Hollywood charm was what I found. The reception staff were very helpful upon check-in, they upgraded me and my friend to a Double Queen and it was absouletly huge. The room had a seating area, 2 queen beds, a kitchen, a desk with wireless internet access and the biggest hotel bathroom I have ever seen. We even had his & her sinks with a huge shower. It really did impress me and I think the majority of the reviews on this website are just from people expecting a five star hotel at low prices. If you want 5 star pay for it! The location of the hotel was fabulous right on the doorstep was Hollywood Blvd, the home of The Walk of Fame, Manns Chinese Theater, Kodak Theater and close to transportation networks. However if you are planning your L.A. trip and you are over 25 I highly recommend hiring a car, the roads are easy but public transport is awful! Everyone drives in L.A. so there transport system doesnt have to be great. However if you are not keen on driving out there the bus is cheap however ask reception for the right route you need and they will direct you to the bus stop. Or use the Metro subway system compared to London's Tube and New York's subway it is a small system with only 4 networks within the system. But again is extremely cheap! Also my top tip:- book a tour to see the Movie Star homes, many visit the homes of Hollywoods biggest celebritys on Mulholland Drive and also the sights of Bel Air and Beverly Hills including the oh so glamourous Rodeo Drive (take your credit cards if you plan to shop there just to warn you prices normally start from $500 for a small garmet and can go over $50,000 for evening dresses and shoes!). Tours are around $35 roughly 3 hours long. Also another tip: - DO NOT TAKE A CAB FROM THE AIRPORT in high traffic it can cost you up to $70 from LAX, so try and arrange a private car from the hotel or a respected company which will cost you around $55 excluding tip. This will save you money. I think L.A. would appeal to adults however young children Hollywood may not be suitable. If you are planning a holiday to California with the kids, try Anahiem or San Diego were it is more family friendly. Overall the hotel was fabulous, the location extremely convient and L.A. is just incredible!! P.S. eat at the popular celebrity hangout Coffee 101 one lunchtime. It is located at the bottom of the hotel and you never know who may be eating in the next booth. A favourite with young celebrities!

Reviews.Title: “Very low standard”
Reviews.Author: Courtney B
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on our budget and weren't expecting anything too nice but definately weren't expecting it to be this bad! The elevator felt like it struggled to get us up 2 floors, there was a weird smell throughout the hotel, we weren't given a room with a king sized bed we requested for, instead we got 2 doubles, the tv reception was almost non existent and to top it all off we were woken by the smoke alarm beeping at 5am because it's batteries needed changing! The location is quite handy though as you are only a couple of streets up from hollywood bld and the diner in the hotel is ok, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, useful location”
Reviews.Author: kitipo
Reviews.Content: I had a good time @ BW Hollywood Hills. My room was really huge (with 42' TV!), clean, and the bathroom was big as well. The only problem I had was with the front desk- they were nice, but didn't looked like they are happy to serve or help you. for the service & price I got- it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in glitz......like modern Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Redlake27
Reviews.Content: First impressions are not good. You enter from the car park into a narrow hall with basic furnishing. The rooms are a generous size, and the hotel has a lot of car parking with a secluded pool. Convenient...but not attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs and smell”
Reviews.Author: RonnyBelgium
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a cople of days BW Hollywood Hills. -Unfreindly staff -Bugs in the beds, bittes and sleeples nights etc. -Awfull smell in the hotel Never again this BW .

Reviews.Title: “bugs”
Reviews.Author: loveshoptravel
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, I continued to stay at this hotel. And everything is true of what I have read. Pros: Great location, great double sink bathroom, clean (besides the bugs), great room with sofa area Cons: Bugs, non-working refrigerator, water took long to heat up, non-friendly staff, cafe downstairs was convenient, but not as tasty as I had expected However, i would not stay here again because a hotel room should not have bugs (YES, MORE THAN ONE...and not just two).

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood horror”
Reviews.Author: Elainedavies
Reviews.Content: Wasnt sure what to expect as there had been mixed reviews previously so expected a bit of a dump. I cant really describe the hotel really. The rooms had been recently renovated (ish) but in a cheap way and seemed very "motel" in its style. We were supposedly in the newer part but it wasnt really. Our room was right outside the air conditioning unit which was loud at night and the lack of security meant that we didnt really feel safe at night in the rooms and please what was that awful smell in the hotel (like cheap polish). Our tv didnt work and we got bitten to death in the night by bed bugs. Never again. It seemed much more of a bag packers hotel than a family one I have to say and our one plus for booking the hotel was the on site coin laundry service was out of service when we arrived and the other (the pool) was being painted during our stay On the plus side, the location was convenient (although we did have a car) and we had a lovely meal at the diner in the evening. Wont be coming back (we nicknamed the hotel the Hollywood hotel of horrors).

Reviews.Title: “Love the BW Hollywood Hills”
Reviews.Author: JennySanDiego
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel the minute I arrived. It is not the newly renovated room that attracts me, and it is not your wonderful location and gorgious bathroom that pleases me. It is your wonder staff who makes me feel so welcome and happy the minute I walk in to your hotel. I loved your staff from the minute I check in, they are so accommodating and friendly, and in the morning, your cleaning crew work so hard to keep every single room so refreshed and clean. One of the housekeeper told me she has been here for 40 years. That tells me the management must be doing everything right to keep all these happy and sweet crew working so hard everyday. Congradulations on your hardwork because you have done a good job to keep customer like me so happy and content. I have lived in the Ritz Carlton in New York City, Four Seasons in Maui, W, Westin and you name it 5 stars in other places of the world. Your little Best Western Hollywood Hill really catches my heart and I would like to thank you so much for such comfortable stay. I love this type of hotel where you will not need to wait for an hour to receive your extra sheets or towels and then had to tip generiously otherwise the billman looks at you funny. I never have to wait for more than 10 minutes for anything I requested. The houseman would cater anything at your wish in a second and will never expect to receive a tip. I love down to earth places and people like you. You are fabulous and yes, I will recommand your hotel to everyone who is comming to Hollywood or UCLA and thank you so much for your friendly and cute hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: jsguyrus
Reviews.Content: I was really hesitant about booking this hotel due to the other reviews. It turned out to be a very pleasant stay and I had no problems at all. This hotel is actually two different buildings. There is the old main hotel and the newer (but by no means new) "pool building". I stayied in the newer buidling and found it has been updated and was very clean. The room itself was very nice and decorated in a Hollywood theme. The bathroom was great with a double headed shower in a very large shower stall. It wasnt in the nicest area but then there are not really a lot of nice areas near Hollywood. I would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ellie188
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, my friend & I stayed here whilst on our road trip, good location, near to the walk of fame/Kodak theatre. We got upgraded because the lift wasn’t working so we had a bigger room, bigger bathroom. The restaurant attached is very cute, proper American style diner, great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HarleyGal59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of March. Our room, on the 4th floor was clean and a nice size room. We did not see any bugs! Bathroom was very big. The restaurant was nice but a bit expensive. (And we saw Sandra Oh in there having breakfast the very first day we were there : ) Very close to the highway and accesible to everything. Only 10-15 minutes from Universal Studios, depending on traffic of course. One complaint I do have is if you get a street side room, be prepared for traffic and people noise 24 hours a day. We had to buy ear plugs after our first night there as we could hear the traffic from the highway (that's how close it is to the highway) all night. Other than that, no complaints. Do rent a car, there is no place to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: rocky222
Reviews.Content: Fully expecting smelly rooms and cockroaches from some of the recent reviews, I was pleasantly surprised by my stay. Stayed two nights in mid-feb in a king-sized bedroom. Room was great and you could see the hollywood sign from the window. They even had a little kitchen area with a sink and fridge off in the corner. Bathroom was great and the dual shower heads were amazing. The only disappointment was the television reception. For some reason there was quite a bit of static and none of the stations were really coming in clean. There was a diner downstairs which was nice, although it got kind of crowded during the evenings and the really low-lighting annoyed me quite a bit. We had a car rental for the time we were there and parking was super. Location was not too bad (about 15 min walk to downtown hollywood) but I would definitely recommend a car to get around the city. If I am ever back in LA, I would definitely consider booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and Nasty Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: handrew396
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on 23/01/08 for 5 nights. The only reason we didn't check out was that we had prepaid and would have lost the full amount. When we arrived we were greeted in reception by a cockroach and the staff were just as pleasant!! However it would be fair to say we didn't see any cockroaches in our room. The reception and corridors smelt like drains and the lift was like a service elevator that had seen better days. We were upgraded!! to a large room on the 4th floor, however the traffic noise 24/7 from the nearby freeway made sleep virtually impossible. The shower took 5 minutes to warm up and housekeeping left much to be desired leaving bins full after the room had been serviced. The only positive remark we can make is that we had complimentary wireless internet in the room and would recommend you use it to find another hotel if you have been unfortunate enough to have already checked into this one!! The all american diner downstairs ajoining hotel serves good food and unsurprisingly is not owned by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches and no Maid Service”
Reviews.Author: jadep604
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on hotwire because of the great rate of $100 a night In West Hollywood area. The room was large with a kitchen however the kitchen had cockroaches and both beadspreads and pillow cases had green and brown stains. After we spoke with the front desk they had no idea what to do until the manager came in the next day. Meanwhile construction was going on outside our window at 6 am and the tv didn't work. All the channels were fuzzy but one. To top off our three day stay in LA we never received maid service. We only had three towels and all our our mini trash cans were over flowing. What a dump!!

Reviews.Title: “Great except for the housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Tylers_Parents
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little creepy outside but the room was huge including a large flat-screen tv, coffee pot, fridge, and microwave. The bathroom was amazing - modern and snazzy with a 2 person granite shower with multiple showerheads. On arrival we found leftover beer in the refrigerator. The 2nd day the coffee packets and cups were not replaced. When we were checking all the drawers before checking out we found someone else's clothes in a drawer. That was about the same time we realized that the wet spot on the closet carpeting was actually from water dripping from the ceiling (somehow missing our clothes) and not from our wet bathing suits like we had thought. The adjoining dinner was convenient but the breakfasts were greasy and awful.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every dollar, the perfect stay for my first time in LA”
Reviews.Author: Dushku_Alex
Reviews.Content: After weeks of reading reviews in this website, my gf and I decide to book Bestwestern Hollywood Hills. And we were very lucky!. The hotel was great, the room was huge, everything was very clean with housekeeeping everyday. Before, i was afraid because some people said bad things about the hotel, but the truth is this Hotel made my LA experience even more happier. The bulding look like new inside, i think it has been renovated lately. The recepcion, even I really dont have many contact with them, was very polite and nice when I ask for something. They charged me the exact amoung I booked in Priceonline europe plus this annoying USA tax. (Be aware everything in USA get a 18% tax after the price you see). Oh and more thing! they have a little dinner next door, It was great the food was incredible, the whole style of the dinner is very LA very American i loved it. I got also the chance to see a celebrity taking breakfast there!!! I was so exiting, I saw Grant Show from Melrose Place... :) He sat just in front of me!!. Apparentaly the dinner is very popular with celebrities in the area: Hollywood hills. Just one thing, please go with car, the distances in LA are huge, we didnt get a car, so we lost a lot of time waiting for buses that pass every 30 minutes, and to be honest the hotel doesn't have many commerce around so you have to walk or take a bus to The Kodak theather area, which will take you around 20 min.After a few day we discovered that many buses actually took us almost in front of the hotel, so it wasn't too annoying. In resume I love this hotel, great experience, great holidays and i will definately be back again in 2008. LA is the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: digiarnie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and cozy - we didn't see any cockroaches as mentioned by other reviewers. It had nice decor. The bed was comfortable. The walk is about 15-20 minutes to get deep into the Hollywood action areas but we didn't mind the walk at all. It doesn't feel as long as 15-20 minutes when you're busy looking at the stars on the ground, Capitol Records and other little stores here and there before hitting Mann's Chinese Theater and such. The parking as mentioned by some people can be a bit tight, but when driving a rental car it wasn't so bad. Might be a problem if you're driving a huge car. There was parking right outside the door, plus there was parking in an underground area as well. We never had problem finding a spot except for one night, but after one loop of the streets, we managed to find a vacant spot in the underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!! Right in the middle of Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: meandmilo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel often from the east coast. We decided to stay at this location because we were booked to see the play Wicked. The staff at the front desk were all pleasant and eager to help us find what we were looking for. They made suggestions for dinner locations.
