We asked for extra towels and blankets in the middle of the night and the lady brought them within a few minutes, no problems. The housekeepers did a great job as well. They always said good morning to us each time they saw us. The diner was a bit loud at night, but had great food. The pictures that surround the hotel really fit the mood. It's in Hollywood and the pictures are amazing. Also, we wanted to book a tour but were unsure as to what to do. The gentlemen in the evening helped us to figure it out and then took care of the plans. It was very easy to do. We loved the new bathroom and shower. Also, I'm very happy they had a microwave and refridgerator too. My husband is diabetic and needs a fridge. It was an added bonus for us. We had to check out around 4 in the morning and the lady the checked us out was still very friendly. She talked to us until the shuttle came to pick us up. All in all, we had a wonderful experience and will be staying at this hotel again in January and March. I would recommend this Best Western to anyone that asks.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: madddskillz
Reviews.Content: I checked in early october late at night... only to find several roaches in the bathroom... I quickly checked out and checked into the best western on sunset. If you look up reviews on the restaurant downstairs you will see people say that they've seen cockroaches there too... and the hotel and the restaurant are in the same building... so it explains alot. They were friendly about it however, and I wasn't charged anything.

Reviews.Title: “fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: books30
Reviews.Content: For the price, the hotel was fine. Room was clean and bathroom was newly remodeled. Bit of a walk (20 mins) to Hollywood & Highland complex and all the action. Coffee shop was good for breakfast & had healthy options. NIce pool. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ingepup
Reviews.Content: We started our month traveling through the West of USA in this hotel and we found it nice. The rooms are clean and we had a big bathroom. You can also eat well in the restaurant and the personel was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: barryjohnsmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK, but not great. The room was certainly clean and comfortable, but I think we could have done better. Rooms are on the small side, and the whole complex feels a little cramped. Parking is tight. The hotel is also a good 30 minutes walk from the main action on Hollywood Boulevard - so be prepared to do quite a bit of driving unless you are keen! As a first time visitor to LA, I wasn't overly impressed with the Hollywood area as a whole. Would definitely head to the beaches next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: red1962
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at this hotel while on vacation in Hollywood. The beds are the most comfortable I've ever had at a hotel. Ask for a room with the granite bathroom overlooking the pool, which is in the center opening of the hotel. All rooms and the hotel are decorated in a Hollywood theme - - - it was nice. The hotel is right next to the highway and close to everything. For those who are driving, parking is a nightmare. There are not enough spots and you are either in a very small underground lot or in an outside gravel lot. This made it difficult for moving our bags in and out of the hotel. If you have a economy car, manoevering the lots would be easier. The restaurant downstairs is an added bonus. I agree with other visitors that front desk staff are miserable. The cleaning staff are very friendly and our room was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the BW Hollywood Hills”
Reviews.Author: Tahoestarr
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews here at TA, I was not expecting greatness, but for the most part, a more than acceptable place close to everything, at a reasonable price. I was very pleasantly surprised! Although the hotel is older (I think previously the historic Franklin Hotel), it was in great shape. On approach the exterior was questionable, and the area, coming from little Carson City, was a bit overwhelming. However, we were warmly welcomed by the front desk staff, and they were extremely helpful. As I got to my room, which was located on the Franklin Street side (I read was a no no), however, I loved the view of the city (especially at night), and since it was very warm, we had the air conditioner on, and it seemed to drown out the traffic noise. The room was recently upgraded, and just lovely. Very large, fridge, coffee maker...loved the old Hollywood glam pictures on the wall! The bathroom was great with double sinks, marble, large closet, lovely marble shower (no tub). Parking under the hotel seemed safe and well lit; However, not enough space for everyone! I will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: osomig
Reviews.Content: i was very dissapointed with the property. the outside of the hotel was very run down and dirty. Staff not very helpful and rude. I had called to ask for directions and the male who answered was not at all helpful!! when i checked in i wanted to pay cash for the room and same male said he didnt know or was not sure on how to take cash payment, but he took my deposit anyways. Security also was very poor! My room key was not working so I went to the front desk and 2 male clerks were at the desk . I informed them my room key was not working. I gave them my room number and they didnt even ask to verify my identification! Also there were so many wet spots i the hotel that guests could have slipped and fallen. There were not caution signs! also when I arrived home, i found that I was charged $10.00 for no reason! I demand the amount credited! nowhere on the website does it say there will be a $10 fee! And it was never mentioned!. I was also given the wrong room type. Clerk made me feel it was my fault !!!

Reviews.Title: “I love it!”
Reviews.Author: Michelles25
Reviews.Content: I was on a girls trip on our way to coachella music festival in Indio, CA. I loved the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The decor was very cool. Our room was great and the pool was on the small side but that was the least of our worries. The location was good and the little cafe was very cool. The food was really good especially for breakfast, it was a bonus that the cafe stayed opened till 3 am. The front desk staff was very helpful for suggestions on restaurants and nightclubs. I will defentially stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive alternative close to Pantages”
Reviews.Author: egyptdragon
Reviews.Content: Affordability, free wi-fi, and walking distance to the Pantages were my reasons for booking the Best Western Hollywood Hills. As a bonus, the room had a nice kitchenette with a coffee maker, fridge, kitchen sink and microwave. Many pricier hotels do not have those amenities. Our stay was very comfortable and the next time I go to the Pantages I will definitely book this hotel again. The slight cons: The exterior of the hotel is a little rundown, but the inside rooms are fine and besides, Hollywood itself is a little rundown anyway. The elevator was out of order when we visited, but the hotel clerks offered to help us with our luggage (we declined because it was only one flight of stairs).

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: lilheathysunshine
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for an inexpensive girls' trip. It's been about a year, but after seeing some negative reviews, I thought I'd add my two cents. My sister and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were in the original building and thought our room was really very nice. It had been renovated and everything other than a really old microwave was just great. Actually, the first room we were given had a window that wouldn't shut, so we asked to switch and were accommodated immediately. The coffee shop downstairs is dark and funky with nicer food than you would expect. The pool area is small, but it wasn't busy while we were there and we got in some good sun time. The hotel location is pretty excellent, too. We didn't feel unsafe walking around, especially during the day. And we would definitely recommend using the subway system. There's a stop nearby and it will save you a LOT of money and headaches with cabs or parking. The desk staff was also excellent. We got great advice about where to go for good sushi and how to get to different places--they even printed us maps! We ended up liking one of the staff members so much that we considered sending him a thank you note! I would definitely recommend this hotel for budget travelers. The room was bigger and nicer than we expected. I'm even thinking about staying there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Hollywood Hills is OK”
Reviews.Author: johnnyqVirginia
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel last month. I was a little skittish after reading mixed reviews, but I was really pleasantly surprised. It's definitely an older place, but my room had been nicely refurbished. My request for a quiet room (on the back) was readily accommodated. The room was clean and spacious enough, with 2 beds, 2 chairs, a desk/dresser combination, and a small closet. There was a small refrigerator, along with a microwave and coffee pot, behind a sliding door. The large bathroom was really nice: beautiful tile all around, with a walk-in, 2-person shower. The staff seemed professional and responsive. I usually avoid hotels with exterior corridors, but the doors and key system seemed secure. I'm very picky about hotels, and I think this was a good value for the Hollywood area. I should mention that another guest's car was broken into one night while I was there, but that comes with the territory. I also spent 2 nights in the nearby Rennaissance on this trip, and I'm not sure the $200 per night difference in cost was worth it, unless you include the celebrity sightings at the Rennaissance. All in all, I wouldn't hesitate to stay in the Best Western Hollywood Hills again or recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderingVFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Hollywood Hills because of its close proximity to the Pantages Theater where we went to see "Wicked" (Awesome, awesome production I might add!) The hotel staff was friendly and courteous and went out of their way to help with directions and anything else we needed. They even allowed us early check-in which we appreciated. We stayed in room 218 at the far end of the pool. If you stay here get a room in the back as one reviewer suggested and they were right. The room was clean, nice and all upgraded with ceramic tile floors and granite countertops in the bathroom. We would definately stay here again if we are seeing a show at the Pantages.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed like a good idea...”
Reviews.Author: carwhet
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel knowing that it was not in the best area of town. The neighborhood was not the problem. Upon arrival late at night, parking was a chore even with a deck. After checking in, we bring our bags in from the car, ask where the elevator is -- yep, it's broken. Four flights of stairs with no help or apologies. Ok, fine. Then up to the room, which would have been fine if it were clean. Hairs everywhere, even liquid makeup drops on the floor. The saving grace was the great coffee shop downstairs. I woud not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Honeyblossom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the BW Hollywood Hills and overall had a great stay. On first impressions we were a little apprehensive, seemed quite shabby in some of the public areas, i.e. lobby, elevator area and car parks a bit dark and creepy but on reaching our room (?122 - at pool level), we were pleased with what we got. TV, fridge and microwave all worked fine and bathroom was lovely and modern. Only a couple of small issues - bathroom window wouldn't close properly but on looking out we were about 15 feet above the overflow car park so no real security problem and secondly no safe in room which meant having a safe deposit box in reception and having to ask for it every morning which was a pain. Loved Cafe 101 - ate there 3 times and always good service and nice food. As for the location, great access to the 101 freeway but a little further from Hollywood Bvd than we thought; as we had a car, it wasn't a problem, although probably wouldn't have attempted the walk at night.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: Philadelphian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is run down and in a less than friendly neighborhood. Although many attractions are within walking distance, we were advised to drive. The desk clerk mislead us to stay in the original building saying that the rooms were bigger and of the same quality as the new one. This is absolutely untrue. He also told us that although the elevator was broken, it would be fixed in a day. It wasn't- - try walking up four flights of stairs! Alhough the room was newer, the renovations were cheaply done and poorly thoughtout. The closet was in the bathroom. The linens were of poor quality and questionable cleaniness, and the towels were like sandpaper. There is no security in the parking area and the hotel. Any one can walk into the hotel, particularly from the resturant area. This is the first hotel that would not cash a check because it doesn't keep much cash on hand. What does this say about safety?! I strongly recommend that you not chose this hotel which is barely two stars and expensive. I discovered that well regarded hotels in the Rodeo Drive area offer terrific deals. Go to one of them!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem...”
Reviews.Author: Cath0508
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best Western Hollywood hills back in November. Now when I arrived I did expect the hotel to be larger from looking at the pictures. But it was great we stayed in a newly refurbished room which was very large and clean. It is just what I imagine an american motor lodge to be like!! It also had a microwave and a fridge in the room. The pool was closed though as we stayed out of season. It is within walking distance of the Mann's chinese theatre and all the attractions on Hollywood Boulevard. Just next door is a brilliant chinese resturant and also a pizza place! (very handy after a hard days walking). To be honest for the price we payed I was very happy and found it really novel. I stayed in this hotel after staying in San Fran (Raddison Fishermans Wharf) and then moving onto Las Vegas (The Mirage) after and was not dissapointed at all. LA is rather nerve racking however at this hotel I did not feel unsafe at all. If I ever visited LA again I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: josefine
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel with two friends, and we stayed for two weeks. And yes, the elevator was out of order, and yes, we had a bit of a key card problem some days. But we didn't care so much about it. I don't know, maybe it's because we're all young and just appreciate things a bit more than grumpy old people. The room was nice and clean, and so was the bathroom. The TV worked, some channels were blurry, but as we said; We're not here to watch TV. The beds were huge and comfterble. The location isn't terrible at all. OK, it's not Beverly Hills, but it's nothing wrong or scary about it. You guys are so scared of everything! The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpfull. They didn't mind calling us cabs in the middle of the night. They gave us maps and even drew maps for us whenever we didn't know where to go. The 101 diner is the best diner in California. We ate breakfast there every morning, and we were never disappointed. The staff was great and made you feel welcome. We saw some really big TV and movie stars there. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Alijack32
Reviews.Content: The elevator was out of order the whole 3 days we were there, so we had to walk up to our 2nd floor room. This was difficult for my 64 yr. old mother. Our room (212) was located on the Franklin Ave side of the bldg. Our heads were literally 5 feet from and 12 feet above the EXTREMELY busy Franklin Ave. The road noise was HORRENDOUS!!!!!! The "front desk" buttons on both our phone did not connect us to the front desk. They didn't work at all!! We had no way to call the front desk if we needed assistance. We killed 2 COCKROACHES in the bathroom on 2 separate days! Disgusting!!!! The wall-mounted hair dryer in the bathroom was falling off the wall. The decor was nice and the beds and pillows were wonderful. The shower was very nice, too. The Cafe 101 (the on-site restaurant) had tasty, affordable food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hollywood Hills Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: monchen
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by retro renovated hotel! Easy to find...good underground parking and clean. Had noisy neighbors for 2 nites but not hotels fault. Room was clean and shower with 3 heads ROCKED! Will definately recommend and next trip will stay there again! Cafe 101 was just ok. Service was not great and food was average.

Reviews.Title: “See Hollywood at it's best From This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: copyright123
Reviews.Content: Wow! If your coming to the Hollywood area to see what Hollywood is all about, you will have a history lession starting in the Lobby of the hotel. My friend and I spoke with the GM upon checkin about the 1942 newly renovated hotel. As you walk into the Lobby you see REAL autographs from Marylin Monroe to Sammy Davis and the Rat Pack. Then when we checked into our room we see more Hollywood in the rooms!...The bathrooms are second to none! We just Staied at the Four Seasons in NYC and these Bathroom are so much larger! Then When we needed to Know about the city, once again the General Manger spent over 30 min with us. I'm sure he had much more to do then help us!...But that is customer service. I will tell everyone I know about this great Diamond of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out early....very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Adamyyc
Reviews.Content: Well, like most of you on here, I research my choices of accomodation and after doing a fair bit went with this hotel. I know that you cant please everyone so thought that the few bad reviews on here were just picky people...that was not the case. First the GOOD Recently renovated rooms, everything seemed clean and stylish. Very large bathroom. Now the BAD When I arrived, there was no working elevator, luckily i was only on the second floor. Television reception was poor. Location was terrible. You had to walk through a seedy neighbourhood under an underpass to get towards Hollywood and Highland. As well the windows were certainly not sound proof, and I heard endless noise outside ( you are right by the freeway). Speaking of noise.... I was in room 202 directly above the coffee shop and the JUKEBOX. I heard music loud and clear through the floor till 3am. Then I was awoken to the amorous activity of the couple in the room above me. Needless to say, I had a terrible sleep. There was almost no hot water in my shower, and I had a chilly one. I agree with another reviewer, the lobby had a funky smell. After 1 night ( I was supposed to be there for 3) I checked out. I stayed at the holiday inn at hollywood and highland. More money, but no suprises and it was comfortable. My recommendation, find a better hotel than this.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: absolut420
Reviews.Content: I'll start out by saying the hotel was in a prime location. It was close to everywhere we were going. Plus the 101 Cafe was a convenient spot for breakfasts and late-night dinners. However when we first checked in we were put in a 2 double bed unit instead of a king room. So we had to go all the way back downstairs with our luggage to change rooms again. They were out of regular king rooms so we lucked up and got a king executive suite, which was much nicer. It would be worth the extra money just for the shower! It was huge and had 4 shower heads all facing each other, which made for one of the most relaxing baths ever! The room was clean and bed was comfortable. However, most people come to LA to party. I know we did. We stayed out until 2am most nights. But we were woken up every morning at 8am by the reconstrution that was going on. I knew they were remodeling, but I think it might have been nice if they had waited a LITTLE later to start work! And forget about taking a mid-day nap. The parking deck was very tight. There were 2 paved lots that were usually full. But look behind the building because we found an unpaved lot that usually had spaces empty and we could see the car from our room. I might stay again, but only if the remodeling was over.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: luckyamerica36
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from a two week stay in California and stayed at this hotel for our last 4 nights. Great location, just at the bottom of the Hollywood sign and only a short walk to Hollywood Boulevard. Hotel staff very friendly and were always helpful when asking for information. The rooms were big and very clean and the bathrooms very nice. My only small critisicm would be the unexplained banging that seemed to go on through the night, wasn't sure if maybe it was old pipes or the lift shaft. Any how as we had the air conditioning on all night it kind of drowned the noise out! Parking was fine, didn't use the pool as the water was freezing. Would stay again and thought it very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: el84
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The great location allowed us to see the sights of Hollywood and go to the Universal studios park very easily as we did not have a car. The rooms were clean and a decent size with a kitchenette. Bathroom was huge and had well stocked toiletries. We did not use the pool. Hotel staff were a bit rude one guy interrupted my question to answer the phone without an apology. Café 101 is excellent. Huge breakfasts and we were told to keep an eye out for celebrities as it is supposed to be a hot spot. Only complain was that the air con was quite noisy. Hotel is very close to the train line that takes you to universal studios and down town la. We booked through expedia and got a good deal. We wouldn’t recommend staying more than a couple of nights. We got taxis home from town as the general Hollywood area is a bit scary!

Reviews.Title: “Big Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: survivorGirl
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the other person who said its no where near as bad as people were making it out to be. The room was extremely big, and its the biggest bathroom ive ever seen!! The fridge in the kitchen was good to store big bottles of water in, which also saved money. The room was cleaned every day. The only 2 things which were a bit argh, were the windows and location. My bathroom didn't fully close, and being on my own was a little frightening. The location is great for people with cars. I didn't have a car therefore found it extremely hard to get around. Very near capitol records, but the area itself is scary. It took me 1 1/2 hours to just get to The Grove. So didn't get to see a lot of things in LA that i would've liked to. The staff were always friendly, but when it came to information they didn't want to give anything out which they weren't being comissioned for. So if you are travelling on your own and without a car, i would say avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the Location”
Reviews.Author: Ilona_Seiert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Hills Hotel for one night in July and it was okay. The stuff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean with a big bathroom. There is a little restaurant in the same building where you can get excellent american breakfast to fair prices. The pool was in a central courtyard and is kind of small, anyways we didn't have the time to use it. Parking was also available for free but the garage is kind of narrow. The location was great, just a couple blocks to walk and then you are on the Hollywood Boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a shot!”
Reviews.Author: Roadworrior
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to stay in Hollywood, but didn't want to spend a bundle and we wanted a pool. The place is kitchy and Hollywood and all that, but they were working on renovations when we were there and the noise was a little much. Also the pool was out of commission on our hottest day there. The hotel has ample parking and a great diner, the 101, which we loved despite the attitude given once by a waitress. We live in the capital of attitude, Brooklyn, so we shrugged it off. I think the location is great, a little seedy for walking, but nobody walks, so what the hey! Being from NY we had to get our walking in, so we strolled around and it was fine. It was ok for the price, a little run down, but maybe they are working on that. We had a pool side room which I hear are quieter, and it was nice overlooking the pool. They definitely need more cable channels though! Siverlake was down the street and we loved that hood as well! Go for it, its fine!

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: gms3
Reviews.Content: We were suppose to stay at this hotel for 5 nights. We are a family of 5. The neighborhood looked seedy. We were not comfortable taking a walk in the evening. The hotel lobby had a funky smell. The pool had huge bleach stains on the floor on the liner. The room had just been renovated, but there was no floor piece between the bathroom floor and the carpeting of the main room. Also, it was suppose to be a non-smoking room, but it smelled of cigarette smoke. Afer staying one night, we got up a 6am the next day and checked out. We ended up staying at the Best Western in Sherman Oaks (Carriage Inn) - was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryJeanC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Hollywood Hills July 27-29, 2006. The room was suppose to have a coffee pot, refridgarator and microwave. But our room was missing these items. We called the front desk twice requesting a coffee pot and refridgarator. We could get by without the microwave so we didn't request one to be brought to our room. The Best Western hotel website said this items were in all the rooms. If the hotel list this items on their website, then the room should have all the items listed. If by request only then it should be posted that way. The hotel was clean and comfortable. It was close to all the Hollywood sites and Universal Studios. The traffic was terrible and parking in the garage was not easy. I don't know if we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Best location”
Reviews.Author: carlywarly
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend now fiance since the trip stayed here for one week at the end of April. it is really a Great hotel. It is in a perfect location. right beside loads of the must see sights eg: hollywood sign which is on the hill behind the hotel and where we got engaged on our trip. walk of fame, manns chinese theatre, wax museum, sunset boulavard , hollywood blvd etc. These are all within walking distance of the hotel. We rented a car so we were able to drive to places like Universal studios and disneyland in anihem. ( You really do need a car if you want to get around LA)(parking free at the hotel) Rooms were perfect, cleaned everyday and has all you need, coffee machine,fridge, microwave, tv. There is a cafe joined to the hotel (called 101) and it is fabulous altogether food is so so good. really miss it! We really had a great hassle free stay would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Do a head count before you Leave”
Reviews.Author: Just_ette
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate, there were no frills but we just wanted a place to sleep after a long day of walking around Universal Studios. The problem came after we left. We realized we had left a much beloved stuffed animal behind. We called the hotel and spoke to the head of housekeeping - she was nice and said yes they had the animal and would be sure to mail to us right away. We waited as long as we could and returned to Germany. We left an address for the hotel to send it to in the United States. After many many calls and constantly calling the manager - who assured us he had the animal we have given up all hope. It's been over a month now and still no package. Our advice be sure you do not leave anything behind you may never see it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but visit when reno is over”
Reviews.Author: count123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over a weekend in March 2006. Thankfully for us, this was our first hotel in the US, for the hotels got progressively better. First the good stuff - the room came equipped with a microwave and refrigerator, which was handy when hunger pangs hit, cos we could stock on on food and breakfast items. The covered lobby with free parking was also a huge plus, as was the hotel's proximity to the freeway However, our room had yet to be renovated, and was in somewhat bad shape. The table lamp was spoilt, as was the shower which had water gushing out when we tried to use it. Also, the hairdryer was spoilt. All in all, the place was a decent place to stay for the price we paid ($100/night), altho we would wait until the reno was fully done to visit again

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Stampede_Queen
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here during our recent visit to Universal Studios, and Hollywood. The staff were excellent, and we were pleasantly surprised by our room once we checked in. Never having been to L.A. before, we had a bit of a challenge finding the place, and after touring the area for over an hour, we realized we and passed by it over 5 times. The room itself was extremely comfortable (we were in room 310) with a fridge and microwave available for our use. There is a grocery store about a minute (drive) away, so we were able to save some money by purchasing the breakfast/snack items. There was no safe in the room, so the front desk offered to store our passports etc in hotel safe after sealing them in an envelope. Thank guys!! The beds were very comfortable, and normally we get extra pillows, but the ones provided were already very full, and soft. We also noted how comfortable the lounging chairs were! The bathroom was huge, with a fully mirrored closet, and a his/hers sink with a roll in shower. The hotel had a little smoking area close to the pool area for the smokers in our party (we had a non-smoking room) where there was seating and it was covered. The pool is a little smaller then it appears in the pictures, but our two sons did use it and enjoyed! The one golden highlight is the 101 Cafe in the hotel. We had dinner and breakfast here, and both times were amazed by the food! Best freshly squeezed orange juice and waffles in California! The service was always with a smile, and our food arrived promptly. We did notice a bit of outside traffic noise from our room, but nothing too bad. Very convenient if you are going to Universal Studios as the walk to the Metro takes only about 10 minutes, (if that) and Universal is only 2 stops away! The Hollywood Walk of Fame is also about 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. Check out took just a few minutes, and we paid by BW gift cards that needed to be converted to USD. Even with the extra work, the front desk clerk was speedy and was happy to help us out. Our family would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: chaela104
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for four nights and really didnt have any problems at all. Our room was large with two double beds, a microwave, fridge and television and both the room and bathroom were cleaned daily. We didnt have a car and as such we were a bit worried about how we would get around before we arrived, but found that the hotel was in a perfect location to visit all the main attractions. You can walk to Grauman's Chinese theatre, the hollywood museum, the Kodak Theatre etc... in about 20 minutes and easily catch buses and the metro to the studios from Hollywood Boulevard which is just a short walk away. We also walked to Paramount which only took about 40 mins. The only difficulty is getting to Beverley Hills, but it isnt impossible - you can catch a bus nearby or join a tour. The only negative thing we did find about the hotel is that the staff at reception are not very helpful at all! They were vague on attractions and would not book a shuttle for us to get to the airport! They will only book a taxi for you with the firm they use. We didnt use the pool while we were there but it looked okay and we would definately recommend the cafe next to it as the food is really good and reasonably priced. You can eat in or take away. If we were to go back we would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hollywood Hills Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6141 Franklin Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
